videos.title: Moonlight (2016)
videos.description: A young African-American man grapples with his identity and sexuality while experiencing the everyday struggles of childhood, adolescence, and burgeoning adulthood. Directed by Barry Jenkins and shot on an Arri Alexa XT camera. You're seeing the widely popular 'Mirror Shot', in which the camera takes on the POV of a mirror – often in a bathroom.
videos.additional_info:
Moonlight (2016)
A young African-American man grapples with his identity and sexuality while experiencing the everyday struggles of childhood, adolescence, and burgeoning adulthood. Directed by Barry Jenkins and shot on an Arri Alexa XT camera. You're seeing the widely popular 'Mirror Shot', in which the camera takes on the POV of a mirror – often in a bathroom.

videos.title: Source Unknown
videos.description: Close up OBJECT POV (as object). To us it looks like the character is looking at the camera, but from their perspective they are looking at a delicious snack inside a chip bag. We just happen to be seeing the world from the chips perspective. Hence why this is an OBJECT POV instead of a FOURTH WALL-BREAKING shot.

videos.title: Nike SB - Don't Make Plans (2021)
videos.description: Worms-eye OBJECT POV (as object). The worms-eye moniker gets its namesake from shots that appear to us how the world might appear to a worm on the ground. We'd consider this an OBJECT POV (as object) instead of a fourth-wall breaking shot because while the character looks into the camera, from his perspective they are looking at a pair of shoes. We just happen to have the perspective of those pair of shoes.
videos.additional_info:
Nike SB - Don't Make Plans (2021)

videos.title: We Are Penn State
videos.description: Close-up object POV (as object). While the character is looking at camera, from their perspective they are looking at something through a magnifying glass. We just happen to be viewing her from the perspective of that object. If you're ever wondering if its fourth wall or object POV (as object), ask yourself if the character is acknowledging the camera as a camera, or as an object in their world.

videos.alt_text: Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste
videos.title: Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste (2024)
videos.description: In Sabrina Carpenter's music video for "Taste," co-starring Jenna Ortega, the duo engage in a gory, darkly comedic rivalry over a two-timing boyfriend. Directed by Dave Meyers, the video features numerous campy horror and cult film references, including scenes inspired by Death Becomes Her and Kill Bill. Carpenter and Ortega repeatedly murder each other in elaborate ways, including stabbings, voodoo dolls, and falls from great heights, only to make up with a kiss. In collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Lizzy Walker.
videos.additional_info:
Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste (2024)
In Sabrina Carpenter's music video for "Taste," co-starring Jenna Ortega, the duo engage in a gory, darkly comedic rivalry over a two-timing boyfriend. Directed by Dave Meyers, the video features numerous campy horror and cult film references, including scenes inspired by Death Becomes Her and Kill Bill. Carpenter and Ortega repeatedly murder each other in elaborate ways, including stabbings, voodoo dolls, and falls from great heights, only to make up with a kiss. In collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Lizzy Walker.

Director - Dave Meyers
DOP - Scott Cunningham

videos.description: Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
videos.additional_info:
Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
A mesmerizing music video featuring a chaotic journey initiated by Diplo's spiked chicken nugget, showcasing wild camera angles, unusual characters, and intense visual effects set in a quirky vintage Chinese restaurant. Director Seaman's close collaboration with Francis ensures a deep connection with the song's rhythms and lyrics, bringing to life a vividly demented world that captivates viewers, with or without the influence of LSD.
Technique - Object POV
Director - Parker Seaman
DOP - Franklin Ricart
Editor - Jacob Ehrlich

videos.title: The Truman Show (1998)
videos.description: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show. In this scene, actor JJim Carrey isn't breaking the fourth wall when he looks into camera. Instead, in his world he is looking into his mirror. We just happen to be be seeing from the POV of the mirror.

videos.alt_text: Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste
videos.title: Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste (2024)
videos.description: In Sabrina Carpenter's music video for "Taste," co-starring Jenna Ortega, the duo engage in a gory, darkly comedic rivalry over a two-timing boyfriend. Directed by Dave Meyers, the video features numerous campy horror and cult film references, including scenes inspired by Death Becomes Her and Kill Bill. Carpenter and Ortega repeatedly murder each other in elaborate ways, including stabbings, voodoo dolls, and falls from great heights, only to make up with a kiss. In collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Lizzy Walker.
videos.additional_info:
Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste (2024)
In Sabrina Carpenter's music video for "Taste," co-starring Jenna Ortega, the duo engage in a gory, darkly comedic rivalry over a two-timing boyfriend. Directed by Dave Meyers, the video features numerous campy horror and cult film references, including scenes inspired by Death Becomes Her and Kill Bill. Carpenter and Ortega repeatedly murder each other in elaborate ways, including stabbings, voodoo dolls, and falls from great heights, only to make up with a kiss. In collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Lizzy Walker.

videos.title: Moonlight (2016)
videos.description: A young African-American man grapples with his identity and sexuality while experiencing the everyday struggles of childhood, adolescence, and burgeoning adulthood. Directed by Barry Jenkins and shot on an Arri Alexa XT camera. You're seeing the widely popular 'Mirror Shot', in which the camera takes on the POV of a mirror – often in a bathroom.
